text:
The USS Conestoga tug boat that sank nearly a century ago has been found by a team of government researchers off the San Francisco coast

U.S. Navy ship, missing for 95 years, found

The USS Conestoga, a U.S. Navy ship, that disappeared on March 25, 1921 has been found off San Francisco. The wreck is on the seabed and largely intact. The ship had carried a crew of 56.

Experts believe the ship sank as its crew tried to reach a protected cove amid stormy weather.
title: U.S. Navy ship missing for 95 years found
